Author: MCB999#4841
Content: I'm developing a gaming platform where users will rate an item. What methods do you recommend taking to stop bots, malicious actors, and miceoworkers from spamming the system. I've been told micro transactions fees to rate, identity verification, any others?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: proof of gameplay won't stop the bots, but it will allow ppl to earn their right to rate after playing

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Txpow

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Why not txpow ?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: How doies that help with a game?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The game poroof of play requries all key press to be sent to blochain as fast as possible... by adding txpow you just slow it down so it wont work any more

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: He was asking about rating items, not proof of gameplay.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Yeah rate limiting by using computing power would reduce imo.  Depends on market though.  Spending $15 a week on constant ratings might have thousands of upside....need more info really - but if its competitive amongst projects for player mindshare, the adversarial side of "doing business" will do what it wants off-chain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Why not just make it so that they can onlyt appear once every X blocks?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Seems much simpler and less wasteful

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
Send a marker to some address, and that cannot be spent until X blocks have passed. 
That marker must be spent to create the next item

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Global rating limits? Eg 10 markers (ratings) every 5 blocks?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: It could, and again depends on all the other info.  Marker would work

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: use a CC EVAL code

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: gives a global address... or any number of global address

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: have a marker utxo that can only be spent after some amount of blocks...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: https://github.com/blackjok3rtt/komodo/blob/jl777/src/cc/payments.cpp#L246

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: each item must spend this utxo to be created

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: @blackjok3r marker pattern, can be used for a token pausing solution?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Eg, I create MYLO tokens, find out my business partner is about to sell some illegally to a 3rd party, can put a pause marker until it can be resolved.  Or say in a game situation, the championship has just been won, the game takes a 1 week competition break/holiday.

So, if you use Linux, you are highly recommended to update sudo package manually to the latest version as soon as it is available.```

Author: ca333#0118
Content: thanks @phm87  - yea, we should never expose an rpc interface to external (unknown) conns. There is even a much worse unpatched vuln around - hammer a coin daemons rpc interface with few thousand simul. requests and you ll get the node to crash. Pre-req for this attack: nodes rpc interface is "public" and has non-limited rpc worker queue...

Author: phm87#7395
Content: yes, I discussed a little bit with dukeleto about this

Author: phm87#7395
Content: in any case, when an attacker is able to use the RPC calls, he can do what he wants and  it is not limited to this CVE.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the CVE covers anything that is allowed to connect to the port, not just things with have a user+pass. That is a subtle point and means everything on localhost could elevate the attack. This makes it so if you can get access to an unpriveledged user on the same machine, you can launch this attack

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is considered "fucked" already for most coins. Having malicious users on the same machine opens you up to side channel attacks, which Zcash is not designed for (see the latest Zcash CVEs) and so this CVE isn't super critical
